# Introduction

This report details our analysis of the Palmer Penguins dataset. Data were collected and made available by Dr. Kristen Gorman and the Palmer Station.

#Analysis


##Plot

```{r echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
penguins_ratio_data <-read_csv("data/penguins_ratio_data.csv")

penguins_ratio_data %>%
  janitor::clean_names() %>%
  separate(species, sep = "penguin|Penguin", 
           into = c("species_common", "species_scientific")) %>%
  mutate(species_scientific = str_replace_all(species_scientific, 
                                              pattern = "[\\(\\)]",
                                              replacement = "")) %>%
  

  ggplot(aes(x = species_scientific, y = length_mass_ration)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.5) +
  labs(title = "The ratio of flipper length to body mass for \ndifferent species of penguins",
      subtitle = "Observations from the Palmer Research Station, Antarctica",
              x = "Species", y = "Flipper length to Body Mass Ratio")+
  theme_classic() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(face = "bold.italic"),
        axis.text.y = element_text(face = "bold"),
        plot.title = element_text(color = "#0099f8", 
                                  size = 16, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(face = "bold.italic", hjust = 0.5),
        plot.caption = element_text(face = "italic")
        
        )






```

```{r inlinevalues, include=FALSE}

gentoo_ratio_mean <- penguins_ratio_data %>%
  filter(Species == "Gentoo penguin (Pygoscelis papua)") %>%
  summarise(round(mean(length_mass_ration, na.rm = TRUE), 
                  digits = 3)) %>%
  pull()

adelie_ratio_mean <- penguins_ratio_data %>%
  filter(Species == "Adelie Penguin (Pygoscelis adeliae)") %>%
  summarise(round(mean(length_mass_ration, na.rm = TRUE), 
                  digits = 3)) %>%
  pull()

chinstrap_ratio_mean <- penguins_ratio_data %>%
  filter(Species == "Chinstrap penguin (Pygoscelis antarctica)") %>%
  summarise(round(mean(length_mass_ration, na.rm = TRUE), 
                  digits = 3)) %>%
  pull()
```


The above plot shows the relationship between penguin body mass and flipper length. The Gentoo penguins has the smallest flipper length to body mass ratio, with an average of `r gentoo_ratio_mean`, followed by the Adelie and the Chinstrap penguins, at `r adelie_ratio_mean` and `r chinstrap_ratio_mean`, respectively.

|Average Penguin Length to Body Mass Ratio|   |
|-----------------------------------------|---|
| Gentoo | `r gentoo_ratio_mean`|
| Adelie | `r adelie_ratio_mean`|
| Chinstrap| `r chinstrap_ratio_mean`|
